sect1.title: Preparation
sect1.para: This section describes the preparatory steps that must be taken before the actual installation of SUSE Linux Enterprise Server. The installation procedure depends on the system used. See the following documentation:

listitem.para: For IBM PowerLinux servers with IBM PowerKVM using Kimchi, see .

sect1.para: If SUSE® Linux Enterprise Server needs to be installed on a number of systems or partitions, it is recommended you create a network installation source. The same source can also be used for the concurrent installation on several partitions or several systems. The configuration of a network installation source is described in .
The installation can be controlled with a VNC client. For more information about VNC, see .
To participate in the linuxppc-dev mailing list, register using the forms at . The following links are pertinent to the maintenance of an installation:

listitem.para: is an effective help tool for assisting customers in solving problems. A corresponding article is published whenever SUSE discover that a special case could lead to serious problems. Search the portal using keywords like POWER or PowerKVM.
Find security alerts at . SUSE also maintains two security-related mailing lists to which anyone may subscribe.
suse-security — General discussion of security regarding Linux and SUSE. All security alerts for SUSE Linux Enterprise Server are sent to this list.
suse-security-announce — The SUSE mailing list exclusively for security alerts.

sect2.title: Installation on IBM PowerLinux Servers with IBM PowerKVM using virt-install
sect2.para: Alternatively, use the virt-install command line tool, if you need to install multiple virtual machines on IBM PowerLinux Server systems. virt-install allows many installation scenarios; in the following a remote installation scenario via VNC and PXE boot is outlined.
